Boomi O O
is O O
the O O
middle O O
ware O O
between O O
success O O
factor O O
and O O
sterling O O
systems O O

Boomi O O
sender O O
interface O O

up O O
the O O
profiles O O
from O O

and O O
send O O
to O O
sterling O O
for O O

verification O O

from O O
boomi O O

will O O
send O O

response O O

an O O

number O O
, O O
which O O
will O O
be O O
updated O O
to O O
SF O O

some O O

receiver O O
process O O
( O O
listener O O

) O O
receives O O
the O O
asynchronous O O

are O O

to O O
SF O O

Project O O
: O O
Alert O O
messaging O O
is O O
the O O
process O O
of O O
reliably O O
and O O
securely O O
circulating O O
messages O O
associated O O
with O O
an O O
event O O
to O O
interested O O
users O O

Due O O
to O O
the O O
growth O O
of O O
Information O O
Technology O O
( O O
IT O O
) O O
and O O
telecommunications O O
sectors O O
in O O
the O O
recent O O
past O O
, O O
the O O
dissemination O O
of O O
alert O O
messages O O
has O O
become O O
prompt O O
and O O
easier O O

Since O O
the O O
existing O O
business O O
environment O O
faces O O
the O O
challenge O O
of O O
reaching O O
increasingly O O
segmented O O
markets O O
, O O
the O O
design O O
, O O
delivery O O
, O O
and O O
analysis O O
of O O
business O O
communications O O
needs O O
to O O
be O O
tightly O O
integrated O O
across O O
multiple O O
alert O O
notification O O
channels O O

Telecommunication O O
channels O O
through O O
which O O
subscribers O O
can O O
receive O O
alert O O
messages O O
may O O
include O O
email O O
, O O
fax O O
, O O
text O O
messaging O O
, O O
instant O O
messaging O O
, O O
broadband O O
network O O
and O O
the O O
like O O

Due O O
to O O
myriad O O
software O O
applications O O
implemented O O
by O O
businesses O O
and O O
the O O
vast O O
demographics O O
of O O
customers O O
, O O
it O O
may O O
become O O
necessary O O
to O O
segment O O
alert O O
messages O O
so O O
that O O
the O O
messages O O
can O O
be O O
sent O O
through O O
channels O O
based O O
on O O
business O O
needs O O
as O O
well O O
as O O
customer O O
preferences O O

Further O O
, O O
in O O
order O O
to O O
maintain O O
strong O O
customer O O
relationships O O
, O O
businesses O O
need O O
to O O
time O O
the O O
messages O O
precisely O O

This O O
brief O O
illustrates O O
how O O
Alert O O
Notification O O
System O O
( O O
IANS O O
) O O
can O O
help O O
organization O O
leverage O O
existing O O
infrastructure O O
to O O
better O O
service O O
their O O
customers O O

for O O

Description O O
: O O
Development O O
of O O
Basel O O
II O O
Application O O
, O O
Basel O O
II O O
is O O
the O O
second O O
of O O
the O O
Basel O O
Accords O O
, O O
which O O
are O O
recommendations O O
on O O
banking O O
laws O O
and O O
regulations O O
issued O O
by O O
the O O
Basel O O
Committee O O
on O O
Banking O O
Supervision O O

The O O
purpose O O
of O O
Basel O O
II O O
, O O
which O O
was O O
initially O O
published O O
in O O
June O O
2004 O O
, O O
is O O
to O O
create O O
an O O
international O O
standard O O
that O O
banking O O
regulators O O
can O O
use O O
when O O
creating O O
regulations O O
about O O
how O O
much O O
capital O O
banks O O
need O O
to O O
put O O
aside O O
to O O
guard O O
against O O
the O O
types O O
of O O
financial O O
and O O
operational O O
risks O O
banks O O
face O O

In O O
practice O O
, O O
Basel O O
II O O
attempts O O
to O O
accomplish O O
this O O
by O O
setting O O
up O O
rigorous O O
risk O O
and O O
capital O O
management O O
requirements O O
designed O O
to O O
ensure O O
that O O
a O O
bank O O
holds O O
capital O O
reserves O O
appropriate O O
to O O
the O O
risk O O
the O O
bank O O
exposes O O
itself O O
to O O
through O O
its O O
lending O O
and O O
investment O O
practices O O

The O O
New O O
Accord O O
includes O O
several O O
methodologies O O
for O O
determining O O
a O O
bank O O
's O O
risk O O
- O O
based O O
capital O O
requirements O O
for O O
credit O O
, O O
market O O
and O O
operational O O
risk O O

For O O
Risk O O
Based O O
Capital O O
( O O
RBC O O
) O O
, O O
Credit O O
Usage O O
( O O
CU O O
) O O
and O O
Stress O O
Test O O
( O O
ST O O
) O O
, O O
the O O
methodologies O O
that O O
will O O
be O O
used O O
for O O
repo O O
style O O
transactions O O
are O O
Simple O O
VaR O O
if O O
the O O
collateral O O
is O O
eligible O O

If O O
the O O
collateral O O
is O O
ineligible O O
then O O
the O O
Wholesale O O
loan O O
approach O O
will O O
be O O
utilized O O
or O O
the O O
collateral O O
will O O
be O O
reduced O O
to O O
zero O O
in O O
the O O
Simple O O
VaR. O O

Basel O O
II O O
Application O O
, O O
Basel O O
II O O
is O O
the O O
second O O
of O O
the O O
Basel O O
Accords O O
, O O
which O O
are O O
recommendations O O
on O O
banking O O
laws O O
and O O
regulations O O
issued O O
by O O
the O O
Basel O O
Committee O O
on O O
Banking O O
Supervision O O

The O O
purpose O O
of O O
Basel O O
II O O
, O O
which O O
was O O
initially O O
published O O
in O O
June O O
2004 O O
, O O
is O O
to O O
create O O
an O O
international O O
standard O O
that O O
banking O O
regulators O O
can O O
use O O
when O O
creating O O
regulations O O
about O O
how O O
much O O
capital O O
banks O O
need O O
to O O
put O O
aside O O
to O O
guard O O
against O O
the O O
types O O
of O O
financial O O
and O O
operational O O
risks O O
banks O O
face O O

In O O
practice O O
, O O
Basel O O
II O O
attempts O O
to O O
accomplish O O
this O O
by O O
setting O O
up O O
rigorous O O
risk O O
and O O
capital O O
management O O
requirements O O
designed O O
to O O
ensure O O
that O O
a O O
bank O O
holds O O
capital O O
reserves O O
appropriate O O
to O O
the O O
risk O O
the O O
bank O O
exposes O O
itself O O
to O O
through O O
its O O
lending O O
and O O
investment O O
practices O O

The O O
New O O
Accord O O
includes O O
several O O
methodologies O O
for O O
determining O O
a O O
bank O O
's O O
risk O O
- O O
based O O
capital O O
requirements O O
for O O
credit O O
, O O
market O O
and O O
operational O O
risk O O

For O O
Risk O O
Based O O
Capital O O
( O O
RBC O O
) O O
, O O
Credit O O
Usage O O
( O O
CU O O
) O O
and O O
Stress O O
Test O O
( O O
ST O O
) O O
, O O
the O O
methodologies O O
that O O
will O O
be O O
used O O
for O O
repo O O
style O O
transactions O O
are O O
Simple O O
VaR O O
if O O
the O O
collateral O O
is O O
eligible O O

If O O
the O O
collateral O O
is O O
ineligible O O
then O O
the O O
Wholesale O O
loan O O
approach O O
will O O
be O O
utilized O O
or O O
the O O
collateral O O
will O O
be O O
reduced O O
to O O
zero O O
in O O
the O O
Simple O O
VaR. O O

Project O O
02 O O
: O O
Concur O O
Invoicing O O
Concur O O
Invoicing O O
is O O
an O O
on O O
- O O
demand O O
, O O
Web O O
- O O
based O O
A O O
/ O O
P O O
application O O
that O O
will O O
be O O
implemented O O
to O O
automate O O
the O O
invoice O O
approval O O
and O O
payment O O
process O O

The O O
application O O
captures O O
vendor O O
/ O O
supplier O O
invoice O O
data O O
, O O
and O O
delivers O O
workflow O O
and O O
approval O O
capabilities O O
not O O
currently O O
implemented O O
in O O
the O O
SunSystems O O
AP O O
module O O

The O O
intent O O
is O O
to O O
decrease O O
potential O O
fraud O O
and O O
mistakes O O
, O O
while O O
increasing O O
control O O
, O O
compliance O O
and O O
visibility O O
into O O
invoice O O
payment O O
The O O
proposed O O
Concur O O
Invoicing O O
( O O
workflow O O
) O O
solution O O
should O O
accomplish O O
the O O
following O O
business O O
objectives O O
: O O

the O O
current O O
procure O O
- O O
to O O
- O O
pay O O
process O O
; O O
Deliver O O
an O O
online O O
solution O O

of O O
providing O O
a O O
vehicle O O
for O O

to O O
enter O O

, O O
route O O

for O O
approval O O
and O O
remind O O
approvers O O
when O O
time O O
has O O
elapsed O O
for O O
approval O O
; O O
Provide O O
a O O
workflow O O
whereby O O

management O O
can O O
approve O O
invoices O O
; O O
Allow O O
for O O

of O O
policies O O
; O O

accounting O O
information O O
to O O
the O O

for O O
all O O

/ O O
P O O
transactions O O

/ O O

is O O
the O O
process O O
of O O
reliably O O
and O O

messages O O
associated O O
with O O
an O O
event O O
to O O
interested O O

to O O

has O O

and O O
